member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.ButtonName
member.summary: The different names a can have.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Input.ButtonName.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates that the input backend was unable to determine a button name for the button in question, or it does not support it.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.CursorMode
member.remarks: Not every backend supports every cursor mode. Check availability with before changing the cursor mode.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Input.CursorMode.Normal
member.summary: Cursor is visible and has no restrictions on mobility.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Input.CursorMode.Hidden
member.summary: Cursor is invisible, and has no restrictions on mobility.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Input.CursorMode.Disabled
member.summary: Cursor is invisible, and is restricted to the center of the screen.
member.remarks: Only supported by GLFW, throws on SDL if used.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Input.CursorMode.Raw
member.summary: Cursor is invisible, and is restricted to the center of the screen. Mouse motion is not scaled.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Input.CursorType.Custom
member.summary: A custom cursor provided as image data.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.DeadzoneMethod
member.summary: Available methods to control the deadzone of a control stick.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Input.DeadzoneMethod.Traditional
member.summary: The traditional deadzone method, where the reported value is directly proportional with the actual value until the actual value is within the deadzone - the reported value will be 0 in this case.

remarks.para: y = x except where |x| is between 0 and d
y is the output, x is the raw value, and d is the deadzone value.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Input.DeadzoneMethod.AdaptiveGradient
member.summary: A deadzone method where the reported value adapts to the range of the deadzone. If the value is within the deadzone, the reported value is 0. After exiting the deadzone, the reported value increases from 0 (when the actual value first exits the deadzone) to 1 (when the actual value is 1).

remarks.para: y is the output, x is the raw value, and d is the deadzone value.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.MouseButton
member.summary: Represents the indices of the mouse buttons.

remarks.para: The number of buttons provided depends on the input backend currently being used.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Input.MouseButton.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates the input backend was unable to determine a button name for the button in question, or it does not support it.

member.summary: The hat is pressed up and to the right.

member.summary: The hat is pressed down and to the left.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Input.Position2D.DownRight

member.summary: Extensions related to input contexts and windows.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.InputWindowExtensions.Platforms
member.summary: Gets the input platforms currently registered with the input system.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.InputWindowExtensions.CreateInput(Silk.NET.Windowing.IView)
member.summary: Creates an input context for the given view.
member.param: The view to create an input context for.
member.exception: Couldn't create input context as the view was not initialized. This occurs when you try to create an InputContext without initializing the view first.
Couldn't find a suitable input platform for this view. This occurs when you've created a window/view using a window platform, but haven't installed

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.InputWindowExtensions.Add(Silk.NET.Input.IInputPlatform)
member.summary: Adds this input platform to the platform list. Shouldn't be used unless writing your own input backend.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.InputWindowExtensions.Remove(Silk.NET.Input.IInputPlatform)
member.summary: Removes this input platform from the platform list. Shouldn't be used unless writing your own input backend.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.InputWindowExtensions.TryAdd(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to load the given assembly by name, checks for a , if one is found it is added to the list. Shouldn't be used unless writing your own input backend.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.ICursor
member.summary: An interface representing a mouse cursor.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.ICursor.IsConfined
member.summary: Determines whether the cursor is locked to the bounds of the view/window of this input context.
member.remarks: Only supported by SDL, will have no effect on GLFW.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.ICursor.Image
member.remarks: The image MUST be in 32-bit RGBA, non-premultiplied, and in little-endian format. Is only used if is .

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.ICursor.IsSupported(Silk.NET.Input.CursorMode)
member.summary: Checks whether or not a specific is supported.
member.returns: Whether or not this mode is supported.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.ICursor.IsSupported(Silk.NET.Input.StandardCursor)
member.summary: Checks whether or not a specific is supported.
member.param: The standard cursor to check for.
member.returns: Whether or not this standard cursor is supported.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.IGamepad
member.summary: Represents a gamepad/controller with a set amount of thumbsticks, buttons, and triggers.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IGamepad.Buttons
member.summary: A list of all available buttons.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IGamepad.Thumbsticks
member.summary: A list of all available thumbsticks.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IGamepad.Triggers
member.summary: A list of all available triggers.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IGamepad.VibrationMotors
member.summary: A list of all available motors.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IGamepad.ButtonDown
member.summary: Called when a button is pressed.
member.remarks: This event is only called when the button is first pressed, and not every frame where the button is still pressed.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IGamepad.ButtonUp
member.summary: Called when a button is released.
member.remarks: This event is only called when the button is first released, and not every frame where the button is still released.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IGamepad.ThumbstickMoved
member.summary: Called when a thumbstick is moved.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IGamepad.TriggerMoved
member.summary: Called when a trigger is moved.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.IInputContext
member.summary: An interface representing the input context.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IInputContext.Handle
member.summary: A handle to the underlying input context.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IInputContext.Gamepads
member.summary: A list of all available gamepads.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IInputContext.Joysticks
member.summary: A list of all available joysticks.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IInputContext.Keyboards
member.summary:
A list of all available keyboards.
On some backends, this list may only contain 1 item. This is most likely because the underlying API doesn't support multiple keyboards.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IInputContext.Mice
member.summary: A list of all available mice.
member.remarks: On some backends, this list may only contain 1 item. This is most likely because the underlying API doesn't support multiple mice.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IInputContext.OtherDevices
member.summary: A list of all other available input devices.
member.remarks: On some backends, this list might be empty. This is most likely because the underlying API doesn't support other devices.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IInputContext.ConnectionChanged
member.summary: Called when the connection status of a device changes.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.IInputDevice
member.summary: Generic interface representing an input device.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IInputDevice.Name
member.summary: The name of this device, as reported by the hardware.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IInputDevice.IsConnected
member.summary: Whether or not this device is currently connected.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.IInputPlatform
member.summary: An interface representing an input platform.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.IInputPlatform.IsApplicable(Silk.NET.Windowing.IView)
member.summary: If this platform is applicable to this window.
member.returns: Whether or not this platform is applicable.
member.remarks: Generally, each Input package will also have a matching Windowing package, and the Input package will reference the Windowing package. IsApplicable works by checking that the given window is an instance created by the Windowing package the Input package references. For example, GlfwInputPlatform will only be applicable for a GlfwWindow.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.IInputPlatform.CreateInput(Silk.NET.Windowing.IView)
member.summary: Get an input context for this view.
member.param: The view to get a context for.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.IJoystick
member.summary: Represents a joystick device with a set amount of axes, buttons, and hats.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IJoystick.Axes
member.summary: A list of all axes reported by this joystick.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IJoystick.Buttons
member.summary: A list of all buttons reported by this joystick.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IJoystick.Hats
member.summary: A list of all hats reported by this joystick.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IJoystick.Deadzone
member.summary: The deadzone to use for this joystick's axes.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IJoystick.ButtonDown
member.summary: Called when a button on this joystick is pressed.
member.remarks: This event is only called when the button is first pressed, and not every frame where the button is still pressed.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IJoystick.ButtonUp
member.summary: Called when a button on this joystick is released.
member.remarks: This event is only called when the button is first released, and not every frame where the button is still released.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IJoystick.AxisMoved
member.summary: Called when an axis on this joystick is moved.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IJoystick.HatMoved
member.summary: Called when a hat on this joystick is moved.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IKeyboard.SupportedKeys
member.summary: The keys this keyboard has available.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IKeyboard.ClipboardText
member.summary: The text currently in the clipboard.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.IKeyboard.IsKeyPressed(Silk.NET.Input.Key)
member.summary: Checks if a specific key is pressed.
member.returns: Whether or not the key is pressed.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.IKeyboard.IsScancodePressed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if a specific scancode is pressed.
member.returns: Whether or not the scancode is pressed.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IKeyboard.KeyDown
member.summary: Called when a key is pressed.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IKeyboard.KeyUp
member.summary: Called when a key is released.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IKeyboard.KeyChar
member.summary: Called when a character is received.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.IKeyboard.BeginInput
member.summary: Begins taking keyboard input. Required on mobile, where keyboard input is usually delivered via an on-screen keyboard. Not required on desktop (it does nothing), but recommended to ensure easy porting to other platforms.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Input.IKeyboard.EndInput
member.summary: Ends taking keyboard input. Required on mobile, where this method closes the on-screen keyboard. Not required on desktop (it does nothing), but recommended to ensure easy porting to other platforms.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Input.IMotor
member.summary: A rumble motor inside of a gamepad.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IMotor.Index
member.summary: The index of this vibration motor.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IMotor.Speed
member.summary: The motor's vibration intensity, between 0f and 1f.
member.remarks: Some backends may truncate this value if variable intensity is not supported.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IMouse.SupportedButtons
member.summary: The buttons this mouse has available.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IMouse.ScrollWheels
member.summary: The scroll wheels this mouse has available.

member.summary: The maximum time in milliseconds between two consecutive clicks to count as a double click.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Input.IMouse.DoubleClickRange
member.summary: The maximum distance in pixels between two consecutive clicks to count as a double click.

member.summary: Checks if a specific button is currently pressed.
member.returns: Whether or not the button is pressed down.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IMouse.MouseDown
member.summary: Called when a mouse button is pressed down.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IMouse.MouseUp
member.summary: Called when a mouse button is released.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IMouse.Click
member.summary: Called when a single click is performed.

member.name: E:Silk.NET.Input.IMouse.DoubleClick
member.summary: Called when a double click is performed.

member.summary: Called when the mouse is moved.
